For more information on these data, please contact the author(s)  OR the Data Governance Office via this email address: dgc@kemri-wellcome.org
latestVersion.citationRequirements: Publications based on this data collection should acknowledge this source by means of bibliographic citation. To ensure that such source attributions are captured for bibliographic utilities, citations must appear in footnotes or in the reference section of publications. The bibliographic citation for this data collection is: "Berkley, James A.; Ngari, Moses M., 2019, "Modified F75 formula for stabilisation among hospitalised children with severe acute malnutrition: double blind, randomised controlled trial", https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/N4RISX, Harvard Dataverse, V1"

fields.value: Modified F75 formula for stabilisation among hospitalised children with severe   acute malnutrition: double blind, randomised controlled trial

authorAffiliation.value: KEMRI-Wellcome Trust Research Programme, Kilifi, Kenya
KEMRI-Wellcome Trust Research Programme, Kilifi, Kenya

datasetContactAffiliation.value: KEMRI-Wellcome Trust Research Programme, Kilifi, Kenya
KEMRI-Wellcome Trust Research Programme, Kilifi, Kenya

dsDescriptionValue.value: In a multi-centre double-blind trial, hospitalised severely malnourished children were randomised to receive standard formula (F75) or isocaloric modified F75 (mF75) without lactose and with reduced carbohydrate. The primary endpoint was time to stabilisation, as defined by the World Health Organisation, with intention-to-treat analysis. Secondary outcomes included in-hospital mortality, diarrhea, and biochemical features of malabsorption and refeeding syndrome. The trial was registered at clinicaltrials.gov (NCT02246296).
